N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 2 ยง 3.4 - Payroll certificates

State Regulations

Every payroll must bear a certification signed by the head of
the department concerned or by other persons to whom the authority to sign such
certification has been delegated. Such delegation must be made by written
direction of the head of the department, and filed in the Department of Audit
and Control. The certification must state that individuals to whom payment is
to be made "are employed solely in and have actually performed the proper
duties of the positions and employments indicated, and that the persons
described therein as 'laborers' are employed at ordinary unskilled labor only; and said payroll for the period is approved at $________ and is certified for
payment from the appropriations enumerated therein, and that the persons named
in said payroll, except those appointed and employed as laborers, have taken
and filed the constitutional oath, in accordance with the provisions of section
62
of the

Civil Service Law, and that all persons so named have complied with pertinent
requirements of the Civil Service Law" (State Finance Law, sections 109, 110). Notes
